reviews.text: Cape Codder is very lovely. The grounds are gorgeous, the rooms are nice and they have all the best finishing touches and offerings one could ask for! They have done an excellent job. The facility has a flow to it so that everything somehow feels central. Love how they have a shop, restuarants, indoor pool, outdoor pools and all are right on site and accesible right from within the facility. They have speakers throughout playing a light classical music (great touch!!!! Loved it!) and it is decorated quite elegantly. It reminded me of being in a Disney resort! The indoor wave pool was better than I expected and with that and two water slides (plus hot tub for the adults) the indoor pool was a blast! Love the building it was in with all the lovely glass doors around it - makes it look spectacular! The outdoor pool was equally excellent and fun. The hot tub was great! The pool set up and added features make it absolutely appealing and stand out from other places I have been. We seemed to be amongst other happy families and great groups of people - an absolute pleasure just to be there. We ate lunch and the Hearth and Kettle and thoroughly enjoyed our service and food. We had dinner at the Grand Cru Wine Bar and Grill which we LOVED - excellent food, I highly recommend it! And at night we went to the camp fire and toatsed marshmallows, watched a bit of the live band and part of the movie being played outdoors! Spectacular entertainment - it was a short stay at the end of a trip but we never even left the hotel! The spa sounded awesome and had a lot of great selections, had our stay been longer, I absolutely would have gone there. It was such a great visit and we had the best time. I definitely plan to return!
reviews.title: Absolutely loved it!

reviews.text: Great time.Staff very friendly. The outdoor pool and hot tub are perfect. Adult only swimming from 8pm - 10pm and they are strict about it so the adults can relax. The only problem we put out the breakfast ticket before 12am as instructed to have breakfast delivered the next day but they never bothered to pick it up(we were down the corridor in the back).We called the next morning to complain and you think they could have delivered breakfast for free but they just told us we could go pick it up. I had teenagers who had a good time. They liked playing tennis, the outdoor pool at night and the air hockey table.
reviews.title: Summer Vacation

reviews.text: we booked into fireplace room, 2 adults and 3 kids 14, 12 and 10. we loved the hotel and were sad to leave it. great indoor wave pool and nice outdoor pool. food was good, staff were very helpful. kids loved the fire at night to roast the marshmallows! great to have indoor pool till 10pm
reviews.title: great family hotel

reviews.text: the rooms could do with being updated, our room was dark!
reviews.title: My family had a great time this weekend at the Cape Codder.
Just ok
reviews.text: 1 morning waitress took exception to us querying change received after we had paid our bill! this whole tipping thing takes getting used to!!

We stayed here one night in August 2012. We rent a house every summer for one week in August and this year we wanted to extend our vacation for one more day and have the kids try this resort. The rooms were clean but a little outdated. The main attraction is their indoor wave pool and water slides. It is not an indoor water park. The kids had a lot of fun there and the lines were very short to get on the slides. The wave pool and water slides are not an all day activity. There were other things for the kids to do. They had face painting and crafts at an outside play area. They do movies outside each night for the kids. They also have a fire pit where the kids can make s'mores. The outdoor salt water pool was very nice. It was a good time but I don't think I would want to stay here for more than a day or two. Price was fair for what they offer.
reviews.title: Nice Resort in the center of Cape Cod.

reviews.text: The facility has some nice features the salt water pool is nice, and the wave pool was fun. But the pool was cloudy and the staff seemed glazed over and non- responsive to guess. They seemed to have no training or understanding that they are important to the overall experience at a resort. That may be the whole problem, I am not sure if it is a real resort or spa at best maybe an average hotel for kids and families. Next the food...way over priced and poor to average in terms of quality, They can't seem to produce anything that was regional or didn't come from a freezer. It seem that they should be able to master great seafood considering the location, but no it was horrible over complicated and packaged... even the soups and chowders. Just not the great experience
reviews.title: Over Rated and Horrible Dinning

reviews.text: This resort is a wonderful place to go with children due to the amazing wave pool- indoors I might add. But the location could be a little better and closer to more within walking distance. Downtown Hyannis is a much better walking distance type of feel- and closer to the attractions. But this hotel offers the wave pool which is what they ate known for.
reviews.title: A great place with kids- but location could be better!

reviews.text: Rooms are average. They are clean and fairly comfortable. The staff will bring you whatever you request, although there is a big of a wait. Staff is always courteous and pleasant.
reviews.title: Beautiful new outdoor pool but...

reviews.text: The restaurant inside the resort "Headth and Kettle" is quite disappointing. Very expensive and food that is served cold. Breakfast is much better than lunch/dinner. If you are able, venture to downtown Hyannis to enjoy breakfast. You'll save $ and have a more enjoyable meal.
reviews.title: We absolutely loved it!!!

reviews.text: Okay, so if you're looking for a brand new, state of the art facility, this isn't it. The hotel is on the older side (towels, air conditioning units, and sliders are among many other things that need replacing), but it was very clean and the amenities for kids were endless. A few things I thought were worth mentioning are below.
reviews.title: A Gem for kids!

reviews.text: The pros:
reviews.title: Great Family Vacation

reviews.text: -The pools. The outdoor new salt pool is fantastic, and the indoor water park, while looking dingy in some areas (like mold on one of the slides), was great for the kids. They LOVED the water slides and wave pools, and it was great that you could be in there from 8 in the morning to 10 at night, no matter the weather.
reviews.title: Economical, family-friendly hotel on the Cape

reviews.text: -The activites. There were movies outside, a swingset, and constant activities going on all day and night. My only complaint about this was that a lot of them (like the icecream social- $4) had a fee associated with it. I would have preferred to pay an activity fee up front to avoid this during my stay. It just seemed like a pain. However, it was great how much was going on throughout the day to keep the kids busy.
reviews.title: OK but I wouldn't stay here again.

reviews.text: -Location. We ate at the Hearth 'n Kettle on site, it was a decent meal and a great deal considering the coupons we got with our "family package". Other places nearby include Olive Garden, IHOP, Dunkin Donuts (right across the street), and the Cape Cod Mall which is right next door. The hotel was in a great location.
reviews.title: Great find!

reviews.text: I figured since the price was so reasonable, the place must not be so good. I was very wrong. I totally enjoyed my stay here. The rooms were large and clean, the food was good, the staff was very friendly. It was a huge and rambling hotel with many different kinds of rooms to offer. The pool and hot tub were an instant favorite. The gym was perfectly adequate and clean. I would definitely go back again, without a doubt.
reviews.title: Very pleasantly surprised

reviews.text: After reading other reviews my expectations were not real high; however I was pleasantly surprised. The property us very well maintained. Gardens are beautiful, room was nice; and a good value ...especially for Cape Code.
reviews.title: Very well maintained.

reviews.text: I would certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: A GREAT Place On The Cape

reviews.text: I am a seasoned traveler, especially when it comes to the Cape. It's one if my favorite places & I know it well. There are many places to stay on the Cape, especially in the hub - Hyannis which is our favorite location here. Hyannis offers the best of both worlds, modern conviences like shops, hospital, airport and ferrys to the Vineyard and Nantucket, as well as the old charm of the Cape. The Cape Codder offers you the same - the best of both worlds.
reviews.title: Met all our needs and was well priced

reviews.text: This was my second trip to the Resort and proved to be the best yet!
reviews.title: It's OK.
